description.narrative: The Government of Finland channels official development assistance in the form of general or special transfers to international non-governmental organizations (INGO).The transfers are discretionary and based on the Act on Discretionary Government Transfers (688/2001). According to the section 15 of the act State aid authorities must take care that there is appropriate and sufficient supervision of discretionary Government transfers by obtaining information on their use and monitoring and any other informat ion as well as carrying out inspections as needed. The Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland is obliged to supervise the use of discretionary government transfers and when needed to audit the supported organizations. According to the section 16 of the Ac t on Discretionary Government Transfers (688/2001) the State aid authority may issue a decision granting another authority or an outside auditor the authority to carry out the audits referred to in subsection 1. The auditor must be a chartered auditor or a uditing firm within the meaning of the Accounting Act (936/1994) or the Act on chartered public finance auditors (467/1999). Auditing firms must designate an auditor to be in charge of the audit.The Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland has decided to au thorize KPMG Oy Ab for carrying out an audit to all the international non-governmental organizations supported during the year 2012. The procurement is based on the 2012 framework agreement between the Ministry for Foreign affairs and KPMG Oy Ab.
